page.title: 19The Swan Inn.
page.content: The Swan Inn was established in 1362 by the monks of Thame. It was first used as a brewery. A large secret tunnel was supposed to lead from the Swan under lands hostile to the monks to their monastery in Thame Park. The Inn was enlarged in the 16th century using ships timbers, many of which survive today, as does an earlier painted wooden post. Queen Elizabeth I used to visit the Swan when it was used as a coaching stop from Wycombe to Oxford. During the Civil War, Charles I stayed at the Inn while his men camped in the field at the back. Lambert used the Inn as his Headquarters for a time. In more recent times the Inn has been extended to include a ballroom and resturant. Some of the bedrooms contain Adams fireplaces,including the Queen Victoria room where the queen stayed as a young girl.
